definition: to be on one's own/to be left alone/to be left out
colloquial reading for 落[luo4] in certain compounds
to fall or drop/(of the sun) to set/(of a tide) to go out/to lower/to decline or sink/to lag or fall behind/to fall onto/to rest with/to get or receive/to write down/whereabouts/settlement
to leave out/to be missing/to leave behind or forget to bring/to lag or fall behind
bill/list/form/single/only/sole/odd number/CL:個|个[ge4]
surname Shan

sentences.english: Packed close together, no one anchovy stands out.
sentences.chinese: 緊緊地團在一起，沒有一條鳳尾魚落單。

sentences.english: Someone has been stealing component pouches from merchants and individual spell casters alike.
sentences.chinese: 有人把法術材料袋從商家和落單的施法者那裏盜走。

sentences.english: Often, people who are alone appear more approachable to others.
sentences.chinese: 通常，落單的人看上去也更容易接近。

sentences.english: You and I are practically alone.
Hence, it never is left alone; and there is no one intends to hurt him.
sentences.chinese: 因爲這樣牠永遠不會落單，也不曾受到傷害。

sentences.english: Later, when one of the boys is alone, he weeps.
sentences.chinese: 不一會兒，當其中的一個男孩落單時，他開始啜泣。

definition: lit. to rush at thin air/fig. to miss one's aim/to have nothing to show for one's troubles
to celebrate a festival/after the celebrations (i.e. once the festival is over)
dinner party/banquet
to help/to assist financially
to snatch time/to rush/to hurry (up)/to seize the moment
to watch a play/to watch passively (i.e. from the sidelines, from the crowd)
luck (in gambling)
to wander/to roam about/to loaf about/to be idle
to go on a tour/to have an outing
see 搶風|抢风[qiang1 feng1]
to fight over/to rush/to scramble/to grab/to rob/to snatch
this side/here
slot within a schedule/timeslot (for a TV program, a session with a photographer etc)/range of dates in which an event is to be held (film screening, exhibition etc)
to travel (somewhere)/(vandalism) "was here"
to keep an appointment
to fix a time/fixed time/timed (of explosive etc)
coupon
